reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Anderson Inn is a family owned and run hotel. The hosts made a great effort to take care of us; ensuring that we had fresh milk for coffee and knew about the local amenities.
reviews.title: Lovely service and great rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was lovely with a whirlpool bath and a view of the sea lions.
reviews.title: Lived up to the great reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a small fish restaurant located within the hotel building and this is definitely worth a visit!
reviews.title: If only every hotel was this perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for one night on our way up the coast to San Francisco. Just like all the reviews have said already, we were very impressed with this hotel. The Andersons do treat you like close friends/family while you are there, personally showing you the room and making great recommendations for restaurants and activities in the area. Seriously, this hotel is the epitomy high class, of exactly how you wish to be treated everytime you walk through the door of a hotel.
reviews.title: The best stay of our lives

reviews.text: Just like everyone has said, the great treatment started right from the moment I called to inquire about rates, ultimately making a reservation. We were emailed pictures of the area, including a pic of the view from our room, as well as info on the area and things to do.
reviews.title: Friendly hosts and stylish room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stumbled across Anderson Inn by accident as we scoured the internet for somewhere to stay to break our roadtrip down Highway 1. This was the cheapest place we stayed in California and without doubt the most full of charm. Greeted by the owners, we were shown around our stunning, immaculate room with a balcony overlooking the sunsetting on the bay and a platform of rather talkative seals barking. It is an idyllic setting and a charming experience. Make sure you eat in the Galley downstairs; the seafood is second to none.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem

reviews.text: Descriptions like "Very Good" or anything less than "Excellent" do not apply to the supurb Anderson Inn and on property Gallery Restaurant. I did not want to go home and I live in Carmel-By-The-Sea.
reviews.title: Don't think twice. Stay at the Anderson Inn

reviews.text: The Anderson family owned small yet luxury inn will make it difficult to travel to SoCal w/o at least one visit to this pinultimate waterside Morro Bay must stay property. The excellent on property Gallery Restaurant w/ bay and Morro Rock views everywhere you look make this a truly first class romantic property the only place to stay on the Central Coast.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay!

reviews.text: Well done Andersons!!
reviews.title: Enjoy swim-by marine life from luxuriously appointed rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our family of five loved the Anderson Inn. Molly and Jeff are fantastic hosts and we wish we had more time to enjoy Morro Bay and the Inn. Our room was clean, modern and comfortable. We had a delcious dinner downstairs at the Galley and then enjoyed a great night's sleep in the very comfortable beds. If we are lucky enough to get back to Morro Bay we will stay here again. Thanks to Molly and Jeff for great accomodations.
reviews.title: Great and peaceful stay

reviews.text: The other reviewers are not overstating what a wonderful place this is! We stayed for 2 nights with our 2 twenty-something kids to celebrate a college graduation. What an incredible time! The location is perfect - right on the water in the middle of everything. And the owners - Molly, Jeff and Rodger were the perfect hosts! They made us feel like we were their most important guests - friends, actually. And the room is beautiful. We had a room with 2 beds, which was located along the side of the hotel. But the view from our balcony was still incredible - right out to Morro Bay and the rock. I'd highly recommend one of the front rooms directly over the bay, though, if you don't need two beds.
reviews.title: Best hotel stay ever!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't missing out on kayaking in the bay. Right next to the Anderson Inn is the Rock Kayak Co. The owner will get you set up and give instructions for even the unexperienced older people! We were able to kayak right by sea otters and sea lions! And didn't get wet at all.
reviews.title: AMAZING

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We're already talking about our next trip to Morro Bay and our next stay at the Anderson Inn. Thanks Molly, Jeff & Rodger for a wonderful time!!
reviews.title: very relaxing and chilled out place to be.
The nicest hotel we ever stayed at!
reviews.text: Myself and my husband stayed at the Anderson Inn in October 2008 as part of out honeymoon around California... When we arrived after a few hours drive from LA we were made so welcome...Unfortunately my husband left out money, marriage certifcate, plane tickets in LA, however Jeff the owner managed to locate all of this and arranged for us to collect it from the hotel in LA. This really is the most beautiful hotel in the world, I could really not have asked for more the hotel is surreal and seeing really is believing...all i can say is thank you for making this the most enjoyable stay of my life..

We arrived a few hours later than planned but a quick change and dinner in the Galley downstairs, excellent. We had been in touch with Jeff and Molly prior to travelling and they met and exceeded all our expectations on our 3 day stay. We had room #201 which is on the water and I echo all the other people staying there, fabulous and views of the Rock. We found the air to be cool at night but with a fire in the room and heated jacuzzi, wonderful gowns ( I bought one to take home) and the hot coffee we were fine. It is a quiet town and almost like going back 25 years in time. We hear 'Play Misty for me' was filmed there and can see the dramatics associated with the place. We loved the hotel, the location, and would love to return in the future. Well worth the trip and visit to see the sea wildlife the Rock and falcolns.
reviews.title: Elegant inn, Gorgeous location, Fantastic, helpful owners!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Anderson Inn for two nights in November. Our room was large, well appointed, very upscale, very comfortable and had a fabulous view of the harbor and the Rock. Our host Molly was fantastic, supplying us with information and advice about Morrow Bay, Hearst Castle, and the sea lion refuge to the north. We ate at the restaurant at the Inn, both nights and the food was superb. I am amateur photographer and lucked out as there was a friend there with a boat and he took me for a short photo tour of the bay while my wife Amy checked in. We hit the weather perfectly and I was shooting sunrises from my deck without even going out of the suite. Morro Bay has fantastic scenery and wildlife. We can't say enough superlatives about it and we highly recommend it. You can see my images at: http://www.pbase.com/rickdecker/big_sur.
reviews.title: Morro Wow

reviews.text: We spent one night and it made a huge impression on my children who declared it 'the best hotel in the world!' which was largely down to Mollie who was so wonderfully welcoming! Morro Bay was lovely and we were pleased we had stopped for the night. The beach and waterfront were beautiful and the Inn itself was very pretty and the rooms a delight. We ate at The Galley where, again, the welcome was just so warm and we were made to feel like old friends. Mollie recommended a breakfast spot which served great pancakes (and they were having the town's weekly vintage car rally outside!). The only elephant in the room was the power station!
reviews.title: Kids' favourite!

reviews.text: Morro Bay is a retirement community with a perfect pace for a great get away from the hustle and bustle of the big city. The people you meet are very friendly and it starts with Molly, the owner of Anderson Inn. I chose an overnight stay at Anderson Inn for my family because of the positive reviews I read from various travel sites. Molly was very friendly and helpful, giving me advice on travel times and various sites not to miss on our coastal drive from San Francisco to Orange County. She was a wealth of knowledge about Morro Bay, it's history, outdoor activities and shopping.
reviews.title: One Night Not Enough
Flawless
reviews.text: The Inn itself, has 8 rooms, 3 of which have over the water balconies. The room we stayed in was very clean and modern. We had a queen size bed, a roll away bed, an HD t.v., wifi computer hookup, fireplace, and a refrigerator. The bathroom had a jacuzzi tub; shower stall with head and body shower heads. The room included spa ammenities and complimentary coffee and water. The balcony overlooked a beautiful view of the bay and the landmark Morro rock. Sea lions abound the bay and frequently swam near our balcony to the delights of our two sons. The room was sound proof tight that during the night, we could barely hear the infrequent barking.

reviews.title: Very nice boutique hotel
reviews.text: Parking was free and the Galley Restaurant affiliated with the inn was adjacent to the Inn and afforded a lovely menu. The Inn itself was on embarcadero st which was right next to the water and supported many restaurants, delis, shops, cafes, bakeries.
